intro: Lithospermum violaceum, commonly known as violet rock pepper, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its violet-blue flowers and hairy, glandular leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its roots contain compounds that have been studied for potential medicinal properties. Lithospermum violaceum is often found in woodland edges and open fields, where it contributes to local biodiversity.
